  • Field Details

    • element

      protected GameElement element

    • shape

      protected String[][] shape

    • width

      protected int width

    • height

      protected int height

    • depth

      protected int depth
      the depth to enforce a particular order when painting the looks associated to game elements. By default, all elements are at depth 0 but it can set to a negative value. The behavior is to show the look of elements at depth -1 below those at depth 0, -2 below -1, ... The look of elements at the same depth are painted in the order they are added to the root pane

    • parent

      protected ElementLook parent
      By default, an element look is not owned by a layout. As soon as it is managed by a layout, its rendering on the viewport is managed by the layout.

    • ANCHOR_CENTER

      public static final int ANCHOR_CENTER
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ANCHOR_TOPLEFT

      public static final int ANCHOR_TOPLEFT
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • anchorType

      protected int anchorType
      define the anchor point of the look within its bounding box. By default it is set to the center of the bounding box but it can also be set to the top-left corner of the bounding box. It influences the way the look will be rendered at given x,y coordinates If anchor is center, then the center of the look will be located in x,y. If anchor is top-left, the top-left corner of the look will be located in x,y Some looks are easier to place when their anchor is top-left, e.g. walls.

    • onLocationChange

      public final void onLocationChange()
      By default, if the element moves, there is nothing special to do for its look because it will be placed in the viewport taking the element x,y position int account, or by using a layout.

    • onVisibilityChange

      public final void onVisibilityChange()

    • onSelectionChange

      public void onSelectionChange()
      by default, do nothing because there is little chance that a text-mode game allows to "select" an element. But in case of, it can be overridden.

    • onFaceChange

      public void onFaceChange()

    • render

      protected abstract void render()
      render() is used to create the visual shape of the element. It must be defined for all types of looks. It is called automatically by onLookChange().

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(double x, double y)
      moveTo() is called automatically when a look is moved within a container look

      y -
